title: XDMarComs
text:
Value-Based Marketing
This course introduces modern marketing practices focused on delivering customer and organizational value. Students explore the shift from product-centric to customer-centric approaches and learn to create value through innovation, branding, service quality, and stakeholder engagement.
Objective: Understand and apply value-driven marketing strategies.
Data and Digital Literacy
This course provides hands-on experience with R, focusing on extracting consumer insights and applying experimental methods like conjoint analysis. It concludes with an independent marketing project.
Objective: Develop skills in data-driven marketing analysis using R.
Agile and Sustainable Marketing Strategies
This course covers ethical marketing, sustainability, and stakeholder relationships. Students learn to navigate the evolving digital landscape, with a focus on responsible communication, research ethics, and digital well-being.
Objective: Master agility, sustainability, and ethics in marketing.
Internet of Things (IoT) in Marketing
This course explores the role of IoT devices, X-realities, and mobile apps in consumer behavior and market intelligence. Students apply their knowledge in workshops to create personalized consumer experiences while addressing social and environmental challenges.
Objective: Learn to leverage IoT, X-realities, and mobile apps in marketing.
Content Creation and Management
This course teaches students to use tools like Google Forms and RStudio to create surveys, analyze data, and build visually compelling dashboards. It provides hands-on experience in content management and data visualization for marketing and communication.
Objective: Develop skills in creating engaging digital content and visualizations.
Experiential Marketing
This course introduces experiential marketing, blending physical and digital experiences. Students explore how technologies like Big Data, AI, and X-realities are reshaping marketing and focus on creating engaging, interactive brand experiences.
Objective: Learn to create interactive, hybrid brand experiences.
Reputation and Media Management
This course teaches students to manage public image, communication channels, and stakeholder relationships. Topics include public relations, media relations, guerrilla marketing, and crisis communication to protect brand reputation in a dynamic media environment.
Objective: Master techniques for managing brand reputation.
Data Analysis and AI
This course equips students with the skills to assess data and use digital tools like gamified applications and AR technologies to interpret consumer insights and drive business decisions.
Objective: Apply AI tools and digital media analysis in marketing.
Academic Research Design and Consulting Practice
This course teaches students research design, data collection methods, and consulting practices. Students work on real-world consulting scenarios, including business audits and marketing projects, culminating in a research or consulting proposal.
Objective: Develop skills in research design and consulting.
Special Topics
This module covers contemporary topics in experiential digital marketing, encouraging students to engage with the latest research and industry developments. It focuses on critical analysis and evaluating the impact of marketing strategies on business and society.
Objective: Explore trends and issues in experiential digital marketing.

title: News and Events
text:
01 Lobbying and Public Affairs in Cyprus


















Presented by Mairy Pyrgou, MScPublic Affairs Consultant, President of Fimonoi
This presentation took place as part of the Reputation and Media Management course, focusing on the role of lobbying in influencing government decisions and shaping public perception in Cyprus.


02 Shaping the Wine Tourism Identity & Image of Cyprus: Theoretical and Practical Approaches







































Keynote speakers: Dr. Maria Alempaki – Senior Researcher, Institute of Agricultural Economics and Sociology, ELGO-DIMITRAElina Christofidou – Tourism Officer, Deputy Ministry of Tourism of CyprusIlias Makridis – Operations Coordinator, Cyprus Wine CoreMichalis Georgiou – Wine Journalist
As part of the MSc in Experiential Digital Marketing Communications (XDMarComs@CUT), this seminar—organized with the Institute of Agricultural Economics and Sociology (ELGO-DIMITRA) and supervised by Dr. Maria Alempaki—examines wine tourism identity and digital branding in Cyprus.


03


















Intercultural CommunicationMarcoms in Slovakia, Presented by Lucia Dancisinova, Eva Benkova
A session on Intercultural Communication, Presentation and Communication Skills – Marcoms in Slovakia was delivered by Lucia Dančišinová and Eva Beňková. The presentation introduced a postgraduate program similar to our Master’s in Marketing Communications.


04


















The Marketing and Media landscapes of India, Presented by Geeta Marmaat
This session focused on Indian communication strategies. A visit to their university further enhanced the international scope of the program.

title: Admission Requirements
text:
The XDMarComs MSc is an elite program designed on the basis of state-of-the-art educational design principles and using teaching techniques which combine academic rigour with practical application. It provides a rich learning experience and advances the personal development and professional networking of participants by welcoming a diverse student body. It values both academic achievement and professional experience and provides a personalized learning environment, tailored to individual needs and aspirations. It offers a traditional, academic entry pathway and a professional one.
